CatDescriptText: Mrs. Henry D. Primas, 6548 Deary Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 22, 1958, pg. 3, with question: "Do you think that there will be an economic depression in near future like the one in the early thirties?" answer reads: "I certainly hope not. I'm a Republican and for that reason alone I hope not.  I don't think that things will become as tough as the economic situation in the '30s.  For one thing, we have learned some methods to halt a depression from living through the experiences of the '30s."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Mrs. Henry D. Primas wearing knitted head scarf with light colored tassels, eyeglasses, and dark coat with Persian lamb collar, standing in front of marble facade with store windows on either side, jewely display on left, and lamp display on right
